caption: When I asked where the bathroom was. “ I’m not a babysitter...”

The food was delicious! Had the Butcher burger and it was the best burger I've had in a long time. I also caught a cool special: $1 oysters! The Buffalo Cauliflower was also really good, but they don't serve it with ranch. You NEED the ranch.

My family and I stopped by to have dinner last night, we sat by the bar and Alex was very attentive, he would check on us and asked if we needed anything,  the great service and food never fails. Great management and customer service, I've been in the business for so many years that feeling like home is rare now days; once again thank you Alex for the great service. Will be stopping by again for that prime ribeye I felt in love with, definitely will be referring friends and more family.
Great brunch experience with bottomless mimosas, beautifully seasoned fries and delicious burgers.

The food is great, the service is good and the outdoor patio is perfect for a warm day during the pandemic. It's was a fun environment on a Saturday night with some good music. I enjoyed the breakfast burger and the santorini salad. They also had some fun drinks for halloween as well.
Nice and big space, young crowd, average food.  A decent hanger steak was served with cold fries.  Salmon dish was very nice.  Oysters were fine as were the chicken wings.  Nothing special.
A nice place and the service was great
Saturday brunch. Great menu and cocktails.
We are visiting family here and had a great time at dinner. Great food, and staff. We sat upstairs outside, felt safe and really enjoyed the live music.
We paid $28 for two mediocre deli sandwiches :( took forever to get them and they missed some things on the order. Not worth it.
Great atmosphere and customer service, the food was also great!
Ordered a great take out meal that was ready in about 10 minutes!
Great staff, killer brunch.

My friends and I had the BEST experience here. We went on Wednesday which is half price wine and $1 oyster night. Our waiter, Kris, was super friendly and helpful. Even while wearing a mask, he managed to make great conversation with us and was incredibly attentive to our needs. We had asked him for another bottle of wine, before realizing we still had some left and he said he would keep an eye on it and as soon as we finished the first one, another one quickly appeared without us having to ask! Then, my friend had the wings and some sauce splattered on her shirt, and without even having to ask, the bartender, Alex, came out with some club soda and a napkin to clean it up. The service would have been enough to want to come back, but the food was also delicious (wings, oysters, and garlic fries! YUM) and the ambiance was also great (love their rooftop patio!). Cannot recommend this place enough!

It looked nice at first, however the waiter was cold and unfriendly.  The dishes were overpriced  especially when your filet mignon is a bloody knot of fat. Baby size portions, except for the frozen fries served with a blob of fat. The waiter scolded us for not having our masks on when he came to the table. No other customers were wearing masks at their tables, NO ONE. Top it off the waiter chases us to the stairs and demanded a larger tip. Definitely never going back. Bad enough the food was such poor quality, but the service as well.
Great food and service! Had the tuna salad sandwich, great seasoning, good potatoes

A solid restaurant that also operates as a music venue. I saw My Life With the Thrill Kill Kult, and the atmosphere was incredible. Great sound, and it was nice to be able to sit down with my drinks and watch the band at the same time.
YUM. The steak from here is unreal! Also love the rooftop patio

Wanted to find a good burger late in the evening, the valet recommended the Chop Shop across from our hotel. What a nice find. It has a butcher shop up front but around the corner is a cozy seating area on one side and a bar on the other and an event center at the back. A lot going on! The burgers were fabulous, the beer cold, service very good and the price reasonable. I was just sorry we didn't get back there before we left.

My friend and I LOVED our dinner at the Chop Shop! OMG, delicious! Most of the items on the menu can be made keto-friendly with a few substitutions. Simply order one of their burgers without the bun or the chimichurri steak with a side salad. The quality of the meat is phenomenal - fresh and well-seasoned! If you're not keto, their mashed potatoes are the BEST in the biz - highly recommend! Also, get a margarita from this place - delicious and STRONG! I'll definitely be back! :-)

Visited Chop Shop to support a band, but had a fairly poor experience between waiting for staff (wasn’t busy when first arriving), getting the wrong drinks half of the time (literally) and then on top of that, being over charged.  I rarely leave bad reviews but after seeing the extra charge on my credit card, I thought I’d take the time to share my thoughts.  The burger was pretty awful too, however... one best part of the food was the short rib pasta, that was good enough to bring this review up to 1 star.
Was charged $2 for ice
Exceptional food, very friendly employees, regularly excellent mood. They charge convenient pricing and the food quality is good. Keep it up.

If you love intimate shows and great sound, Chop Shop is your venue. Ideal size and space. Good selection of drinks. It's the coziest venue in Chicago. I am always watching their show listings for artists I like.
I had a wonderful time in this restaurant. We liked the first-rate atmosphere and the meals. The staff members are super welcoming. I’m content we ultimately managed to try this restaurant.
The staff is lovely and the food is fantastic. Very cool atmosphere - quite intimate for shows (and I love that). Recommend the veggie burger/patty, hard to find one that tastes that good.

Decent venue for a show but be weary when paying with a credit card as they will charge you more than you tipped even if you tipped the usual amount. I don’t like dishonest venues so I will not be returning here.
Love this place! You can eat drink and watch awesome bands all in one place! We came here for 3 nights for the War on Xmas with the Lawrence Arms and it was epic!
Mercilessly badgered over 20$ minimum bar tab. Stop doing the bidding of your greedy owner. Credit card fees are a fact of life for posh bar owners.
Excellent concert venue.  Good sound. Great staff. Great vibes.  All around a good time!
Very unprofessional staff. Been to venues all over Chicago and this one is by far the worst. Wouldn’t go here if you paid me. Don’t give them your business. Absolute trash.
I had a wonderful time in this restaurant. We liked the first-rate atmosphere and the meals. The staff members are super welcoming. I’m content we ultimately managed to try this restaurant.
Atmosphere was relaxing. Food was delicious! We came here from ohio to see Conor Maynard and Anth! Great venue!
Fantastic place. The food was great and the service was awesome
Great aesthetic and staff!
Awesome place! Had an amazing time🤘🏻

I love everything about this place, great food, great drinks, great bands. This is the premier venue in Chicago, Kat is by far the best, great suggestions on mixed drinks, beer or food. You can’t go wrong here.
The staff is lovely and the food is fantastic. Very cool atmosphere - quite intimate for shows (and I love that). Recommend the veggie burger/patty, hard to find one that tastes that good.

My family and I came in from Buffalo for Patrick Lives On. Before the event we enjoyed lunch there. Management and staff phenomenal and most accommodating. I highly recommend both the Patrick Lives On Fundraiser and enjoying and meal at The Chop Shop.

Such a great place to see a band! Super friendly staff that will readily hook you up with a flyer from the show, I watched the owner comp a guy who simply asked how much it was, and she put him on the list, cuz she felt like giving. I usually meet whomever I go to see if I politely stick around after, and this venue books a lot of great bands. It is a real butcher shop that normally closes around 10 PM I am told here on Google, as it also is a restaurant/bar. It has an amazing bathroom and handwashing station separate from each other. I love this place, and have since I first came here. I have never had an issue, and I have seen them deal with issues swiftly, safely, and fair to the people causing the issues. I rarely see anyone ejected if they comply to the fair staff suggestions. Parking is 7 days a week in this area, as a heads up. I find parking easy and cheap enough if you arrive early, which I always recommend one do. Come early, check out ALL THE BANDS! OPENERS OFTEN SLAY A CLOSER, JUST STATING FACTS!!!
BS pork chop. Why would you mess up the fresh meat with terrible sauce and charge $24.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST CONCERT VENUE. Saw a couple of my fav djs here last weekend and this has got to be the best venue. They don’t over sell their shows which allows a lot of room to move and have fun. They also allow you to leave if you are 21+. Had free water stations at the bar which was a major plus. I had 80$ put away just for water for the night but I got to spend it on merch thanks to this 🥰

I was yesterday to watch the final game of Copa America, event that was promoted in a Brazilian Facebook page. The place is good, however the employees were worried because after the game they would had a concert, so, the people there should leave to prepare for the concert. So bad to be in a place where the employees are not happy to serve you... Second, I spend around $60 in the first tap, however, they didn’t accept to use my card to get one more beer... they said that they only accept card over $20.. I said that I already spend more than this, however the employees were instructed to avoid accept card if you don’t spend more...  So bad experience...

Great place with wonderful food. Bring your friends, great hangout spot. The music is very eclectic and was quite enjoyable. They definitely have something you'd like. I go for the steak and the wine. Highly recommend this restaurant. My reviews are for the best of the best. Don't think about it, just go there! My advice? Take it, it'll be the best decision you've made in a long time. Like & Share. Follow me, I'll keep you well fed.
Very good place to see bands. Sight lines are nice from everywhere in venue. Has a nice outdoor patio on 2nd floor.
The security was really attentive to patrons needs.
Oysters are insipid.
Great atmosphere, always great music 5 stars

Great place to watch a game, enjoy a steak, or hear some live music. The Shop also rents space for charity and other events, so it's got a cool ethos as well.  The staff is friendly and takes care of regulars.
Concert venue was great.  Offered several different vantage points.  Was sold out but there was still room to move and they had water stations on the bar!!!!!

The deli counter is gone? What a shame.. only 5 sandwiches on the menu, they’re making sandwiches in the back, and i was told i couldn’t customize.. that was 20min ago and i’m still waiting for a cold cut.
Good times were had at grateful shred turning into one of my favorite Chicago music venues! Lots other late late night options after dinner or shows blue line damen stop
I think I came too early, even though they open at 11am, they aren't up to speed until 12pm, really disappointing. Great ambiance though.

(Translated by Google) The service was good and the snacks tasty. I ordered a vegetarian snack and it came with a lot of potatoes that were well made, dry but a bit too salty. The place was empty on the day, even having an event on the bottom. I do not know if I arrived very early (9pm). Close to the subway and easy access.  (Original) O atendimento estava bom e os lanches gostosos. Pedi um lanche vegetariano e já veio com uma porção de batatas que estavam bem feitas, secas mas um pouco salgadas demais. O lugar estava vazio no dia, mesmo tendo um evento na parte de baixo. Não sei se cheguei muito cedo (21h). Perto do metrô e fácil acesso.
Cool vibe and nice burger.
Nice looking club with a great stage with very good acoustics and a top sound system.
Great food, better music and good vibes
Food was delicious, the band was fun. Check it out!

I was walking by and honestly I thought this was a meat market. I walked in and met a woman at the counter that mentioned they had a full dine in experience and as I looked past her I could see a very enticing bar. As I walked back to the bar to get a drink I noticed a huge stage in the back in which they were preparing for a performance. It was surprise after surprise walking into this place. And in a great way. As I sat down at the bar Alex the Bartender continued to surprise me by going above and beyond. The cocktail was Amazing but then he gave me a tour of the space and invited me to stay for the show they were preparing for. Honestly this place shocked and amazed me the whole way through. I appreciate these types of businesses that continue to think outside the box and offer an experience that is authentic and unique. My highest praises for my experience at the Chop shop.

Good food, nice venue, good sounding room, Chris the sound engineer rules. Even with a sold out show there were plenty of clean bathrooms. Sidekick Kato, Apocalypse Hoboken, Haymarket Riot played to a birthday party for Rise Against. I love Chicago.

As a concert venue, this place is amazing with really top notch equipment and a cool vibe. The food here is so-so .Also, if you don't live within the city, parking is a nightmare here for a meal and a concert.
Amazing food!!!

Really cool venue attached to a sweet place to get your food and drink on. When the acts go one stage, they panel doors leading into the venue space swing wide open, so you can still chill in the bar and still feel part of the action.

Made the mistake of coming here on the night of a show. I was given a drink menu by a bartender. It looked fantastic and I had a hard time choosing. However, apparently it was an error as they don’t serve cocktails on the nights of shows. It was a turn off.
Excellent ambiance and the food was amazing. The restaurant itself is large but really cozy, there's even a stage in the back for concerts.
best little venue in chicago. They have permanent funktion1 speakers installed, which are some of the most cutting edge tech on the market
Delicious, and very cool venue!
Wings are awesome!!! Drinks reasonably priced and taste yummy!!
Great bar and venue for the concert we attended! Very fun atmosphere
Try the truffle and steak. I asked for mid-rare, I got the perfect mid-rare. Wished I live closer, this would be my weekly eat out spot.

Thoroughly mediocre burgers. It should be easy to cook an 8 oz burger to medium rare, but they struggle with this. On the positive side the flavor was ok without relying too much on salt. Relatively slow service.
Great vibes, great beer selection, and the music venue is intimate & hosts a versatile selection of artists.

Chop shop is cool. As far as venues go, the people who book shows there are generally up and coming and the space more of an intimate/small/medium kinda venue somewhere between a dive bar and an actual place that only does music. The sound system is great. The people are competent
So great. Saw Satsang (who would make anywhere better than it reslly is lol) staff were great, prices decent for the city. Cant wait to be back to try the noms.
I wish I could remember my waitresses name because her service was incredible. I ordered the burger of the month. which was so good. It all tasted so fresh and they have really unique menu options.
Love coming here for concerts. But as a restaurant, the food is decent and service is eh -_-
What a FANTASTIC space. Great service, incredible food, decent beer selection, and damn the stage sounded super nice.

Went here for a concert, so I didn't try any of the food, even though the burgers looked amazing.  The stage is in the far back and it's not a huge venue.  It probably holds a couple hundred people.  It has ample balcony space, if you want to get out of the crowd for a bit.  The sounds was pretty good as well. On the ground, there was no gate, so you could get right up to the stage, which was probably a little under 5 foot of the ground.
The burger is amazing, the staff are angels and the music venue is intimate, what not love ❤️
Also a great music venue.

I like chop shop  I don't understand why they can't fix their kitchen problems though . Every time I go in they always have cold fries.  This time in addition to the cold fries, my hanger steak was cold and my wife's burger was burnt. Don't know why they can't fix this issue

What a rad experience as I saw "The Packed A.D." a their.  Besides having great bands this is a solid venue w/ a solid bar and restaurant as you walk through.  The staff are friendly which helps you enjoy the shows.
Couldn’t tell you how the food is because the hour on the website and google are wrong...the “kitchen open late” neon is still on...wish it actually was 🙄

5 stars if you’re going for a concert. Had a lot of fun when I saw Terrapin Flyer here. Great beer on tap.  2 stars if you’re going for food.  Hostess was unenthusiastic and not very welcoming. Server was friendly and atmosphere was nice. Food wasn’t great. Burger was over cooked and sriracha chicken sandwich was so salty I couldn’t eat it.  Cocktails were nothing special. Don’t recommend eating here.
Saw the Korean band, The Rose, here and the concert room was great!!

First time - went for dinner and got a burger. My buddy didn’t enjoy it as their burger tasted noticeably worse than mine. Second time ordered a sandwich from the lunch menu and it was pretty plain tasting. Third time ordered the butchers burger through grubhub - chop shop never communicated it was ready so I stopped by a half hour after it was supposed to be, despite grubhub saying it’s still being prepared, and there it was sitting in the front for who knows how long. Needless to say, wasted my money there again. Struck out with chop shop.

Have not tried the food but I went here for a music venue and the location is so cute! People were very friendly and having a restaurant next to a music concert is very convenient. Should host more venues for sure!

Food is good enough but online ordering is unreliable. Multiple times the restaurant ignored my order until I came at the specified pickup time. One time this happened, the order was even specifically marked "ready for pickup" as if someone had confirmed the food was ready even though nobody had made it yet.
Really great sandwiches! Very cool location, can't wait to come back and check out a concert here!
Bartenders were rude to my friend
Bartenders are slow, especially the skinny dude with tattoos and a beard.
Great burger. Music venue in the back is fantastic. Great liquor selection and friendly bartenders
Worst place to serve drinks in Chicago

I used to walk past this place all the time but never went, I was missing out! Chop Shop is a lot roomier than it appears on the outside, it even has a rooftop patio and a large room in the back for events or party rentals.  The atmosphere is great, very laid back and also a surprising amount of tvs if trying to catch some of a game.  The brunch food was fantastic. The French toast with blueberries and pistachio was so sweet and rich! But I especially liked the sausage sandwich. The biscuit had a perfect crumble to it and bacon baked in. Will have to visit again to try out lunch or dinner options!
Came here for New year's day brunch-- awesome lobster Benedict and they have a great shop in the front
I love Choo Shop! My husband and I go regularly for their delicious sandwiches and you can never go wrong with the butcher shop options in front!
Always busy, but the service is great
One of, if not the best Italian Beef I've had since moving to the city. The sandwich/lunch menu is actually quite reasonable given the neighborhood.

I've just moved to the area and am so happy an acquaintance recommended Chop Shop for lunch this week. The beet and goat cheese salad I ordered was probably the BEST beet and goat cheese salad I've ever had (and I basically order beets and goat's cheese salads wherever I see one on a menu). The atmosphere is really nice and comfortable, with more casual seats by the window, where I sat as I was time-limited, and nicer, comfy seating further back into the shop/bar, which is deceptively large. I can't wait to go back for more.
If you like using your pants as a napkin, fingers as a fork for your salad, and tough bread. This is the place for you! Cash me oussah.

We walked in for an early dinner, we were seated immediately on the second floor and service was great throughout the whole visit.  I had a great ribeye, tasty and well prepared.  After dinner we explored a little and saw the performance space in the rear and the butcher counter in front.

Best dining experience I've had in a long time!   Food, service, prices, neighborhood--all great.  The variety of meat/cheese/etc on the Butcher's Board was impressive, medium rare burger was done just right, servers made great suggestions, and we loved watching the neighborhood scene and the "L" go by outside.  Wish we had another day in Chicago--we'd go back here to eat.
This place rocks.....all good
Very Italian and wonderful
The Official College Bar of the University of Colorado!  Great staff! Great food! Great Prices! And Awesome scene when a game is on the big screen in the back!  GO BUFFS!
I play in a bocce league here on Mondays. The people are great and the beer selection is decent, generally a fun time.
Great atmosphere. Didn't like that you could only get the oysters raw. Hangar steak was great but the Cobb salad had wayyyy too much Bleu cheese.
Had the rib eye. It was delicious!

The Chop Shop is the BOMB!!  excellent  steaks!!  service was great, friendly and attentive!!!  THE DELI  IS GREAT ALSO!!  AND HAVING A BUTCHER SHOP TOO BUY SOME OF THE FINEST STEAKS I HAVE EVER BOUGHT TOO TAKE HOME!!! I RECOMMEND!!  THE  KANSAS CITY CUT STEAK!!!

Awkward setup with the deli in the front and bar/event space in the back. The food is fine. Decent bar food. The layout, service, feel, and flow could use some work. We've been a couple of times for dinner & drinks before a show in the back at 1st Ward Events. The ambiance feels a little "cookie cutter" or contrived. We've had some okay bartenders, but some really bad ones as well. Some seem unfamiliar with the drink specials and little features on the menu (like "Choose your bitters") and are a little rude and/or disengaged. The cocktails aren't very well-balanced and could be more thoughtfully crafted.  I guess for what it is, it's fine. Not sure I'll be back, unless I'm dying to see one of the shows.
The Chop Shop is where you'll find some of the finest meats similar to an old time butcher shop. As an added bonus, you can have a drink and a meal in house in a relaxed atmosphere.

Our service was par, she only checked on us 4 times in 1.5 hours (arrival, drink order, when we received our food, and if we wanted dessert . Though our food was good, it was not good for the price.  I would not come back for the"chops"!  I also got charged for a beer i said "I'd drink" so it didn't go to waste, though I didn't want it, I was just not wasting booze!  Place is sweet though, especially the patio!
Multilevel restaurant with an event space in the back. Vast menu, from burgers to oysters.
Food was fantastic. Excellent service. Great cocktails and wine selection. I don't know if the roof is one of the best in chicago, but it certainly is cool.

Fantastic space for whatever you're looking for. Great drinks and beer list if looking for a place to drink (patio is great if it is nice out). Legitimately upscale food at non upscale prices, a little bit for everyone. And then the deli if you're just looking to grab and go. Can't recommend it enough.
Been to two shows here. I like the vibe.
The Chop Shop is an awesome deli/butcher shop with fresh meats to order, a restaurant with a great menu and a live stage for bands.
Didn't have food here. The review is for the music space in the back. Ample room for dancing and good sight lines to the stage from almost anywhere in the space

A cute no frills location that has in in-house butcher shop that sells locally sourced and responsibly farmed meats, dairy and produce.  They also have a restaurant that sells sandwiches, panini's, and salads.  Prices are very reasonable and range from $7 to $13 for sandwiches, or make it a full meal with their "standards" that come with fries, prices range from $12 to $19.  They also offer catering for parties and hot and cold platter options. #CitiExperts     @Localguides

Went last Saturday evening and was absolutely in love with the ambiance and overall structure of the restaurant. Downstairs is the deli shop and we were sat upstairs for dinner. If you are a fan of dimly lit, warm and cozy dining settings, this is really nice. It’s modest but well-kept and there is a nice, ongoing, soft murmur from people around you. We wanted to try different appetizers and share so we went with the Signature Butcher’s Board – chef’s choice. It was a nice assortment of cheeses, salamis and some jams and aioli to compliment the meats and cheeses. We later got another board with the ones we liked most (lamb slices were the absolute best, in my opinion). Then we did the East & West Coast Oysters (good, but a bit raw for my taste), and the Steak Tartare (super tender and melts in your mouth with an aioli sauce). I’m a huge fan of hard cider so I tried all of theirs (Seattle being the best). Definitely a place I would recommend for a date or casual to semi casual occasion. They have another section of the restaurant and place where there’s live music (we didn’t get to make that.) And the staff is extremely warm and amiable. Headed back sometime soon!

I don't understand how this place has over 4 stars. The food was exceptionally greasy (one bite into the burger and grease trailed down my wrist). We also ordered the gnocchi which had minimal flavor. The fries that accompanied the burger were soggy and clumped together. Check out the unappetizing photo (full disclosure: it's a personal source of shame that I consumed half of this awful meal). The one shining moment was the meatball appetizer. Ambience and service were perfectly fine. If you are coming here with hopes of quality food, I'd recommend going elsewhere.
Simply the best
Shelley.
Very lovely space; beautiful vibe. I highly enjoyed myself.
Umm... This was the best burger I've ever had. The waitress was so professional, the atmosphere was great, and even the owner was around and a super nice guy. Will definitely be back.
Really friendly staff. Deli could have a bit more variety. Great beer list lots of local beer food menu is pretty good and tastes great. We'll worth going too
Went for an event in the back room. Nice, open area with easy access to bar. Decent beer selection, did not try any food.
It was exhilarating, getting to see Mystery Skulls here! The restaurant and bar also provide a nice selection of food and drinks!
Great selection of meats & cheese. Along with dining options... The dining is a little expensive.
Best meat in the city hands down. Not to mention the bars great! Plus the patio! Just wish they put on more shows in the venue!

Super fun venue - been here for a couple of events. It's a deli in the front, and party in the back. They make a delicious bloody mary for the brunch mornings, but also have a solid selection of other drinks. Great for a nice stop in on rainy days!

Chop Shop is part restaurant, part grocery/deli, and part event space. The space is enormous - great for events or big groups. It's very easy to just stop by here and check out what's happening in the 1st ward (event space) and get some Italian salami to take home. As far as the restaurant is concerned, one word is enough to describe it (or two words?): MEATBALLS! Really exceptionally great meatballs here and I can't wait to go back again for some more.

Great place to eat ...they also have a large space for their events...soon as you walk in you see an array of meats and etc...quite dark yet spacious. It's nearby other food places such as a bakery, an empanada place. I've gone twice, and both times I've thoroughly enjoyed myself there.

Hold up! Locally sourced, family-farm meats (like Slagel Farms), just like you get at WF, but a couple bucks less per lb???  Color me happy (and full, and a few bucks richer).  And I've eaten here several times, and it's always been hands-down delicious.  The roasted chicken is *superb*, and the salmon cooked to perfection. Oh, and oysters!  Get the oyster sampler thing, it's a recipe for romance and laughter on a date night ;-)  Kid-friendly too, especially downstairs in the casual deli/butcher area tables.

We ended up having drinks and dinner @ the bar upstairs in the 1st Ward.  The drinks were AMAZING.  Everyone should try the Rhubarb Tart cocktail.  The zucchini fritters were so delicious.  I had a the burger--the meat was so fresh and cooked perfectly.  My boyfriend had the chicken.  It melted in our mouths! I cannot wait to go back to this interesting space.  There are so many different areas and all unique!!
Porchetta sandwich was delicious. I will be back for sure.

The Chop Shop is a missed-mash of an event space, Italian deli & restaurant. The food is alright, unadventurous, and a bit over-priced. Not sure how it's going to survive in the WP climate. On the other end, it is safe, there's something for everyone & the staff is wonderfully helpful.

I was highly impressed with every aspect of the Chop Shop. The customer service was excellent.  We had six people in our party, so we tried a lot of dishes and everything was fantastic. Honestly, I cannot remember the last time I had food that good in a restaurant.The atmosphere is friendly and warm. If I lived closer I would eat there on a regular basis. (They also have a butcher, deli, bar, and event space!)
